title: Colossians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Colossians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'firstborn of every creature' in Colossians?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ is called the firstborn of every creature, showing His preeminence in creation.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Paul praying that the Colossians might be filled with the knowledge of God's will?
options: To walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing
questions.correctAnswer: To walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing
questions.explanation: Paul prays that they might walk worthy of the Lord, being fruitful and increasing in knowledge.

questions.question: Which fellowservant of Paul is mentioned as a faithful minister of Christ for the Colossians?
questions.explanation: Epaphras is described as a dear fellowservant and faithful minister of Christ for the Colossians.

questions.question: What has God delivered the Colossians from, according to Paul?
questions.explanation: God has delivered them from the power of darkness and translated them into the kingdom of His Son.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For in him dwelleth all the ______ of the Godhead bodily.'
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the fullness of God dwelling bodily in Christ.

questions.question: According to Colossians, what should believers beware of that might spoil them through philosophy and vain deceit?
questions.explanation: Paul warns against being spoiled through philosophy and vain deceit after the tradition of men.

questions.question: True or False: Paul encourages the Colossians to continue observing the Sabbath strictly as a way to grow in Christ.
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that these ordinances are shadows and that the body is Christ, discouraging legalistic observance.

questions.question: What is the 'circumcision made without hands' referring to in Colossians?
options: The putting off of the body of sins by Christ's circumcision
questions.correctAnswer: The putting off of the body of sins by Christ's circumcision
questions.explanation: This refers to a spiritual circumcision, symbolizing putting off sinful flesh through Christ.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are ______, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.'
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts believers to set their affection on things above.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a member to mortify (put to death) in Colossians 3?
questions.explanation: Kindness is encouraged, whereas fornication, covetousness, and malice are to be mortified.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians teaches that there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision in Christ, for Christ is all and in all.
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes unity and equality in Christ, transcending ethnic and social distinctions.

questions.question: What virtue does Paul call the 'bond of perfectness'?
questions.explanation: Paul states that charity (love) is the bond of perfectness.

questions.question: According to Paul, how should servants obey their masters?
options: With singleness of heart, fearing God
questions.correctAnswer: With singleness of heart, fearing God
questions.explanation: Paul instructs servants to obey sincerely, as to the Lord and not men.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and ______.'
questions.explanation: Masters are commanded to treat their servants justly and fairly.

questions.question: What does Paul ask the Colossians to do 'withal praying also for us'?
options: That God would open a door of utterance
That they might build a church
questions.correctAnswer: That God would open a door of utterance
questions.explanation: Paul asks for prayer that he might speak the mystery of Christ clearly.

questions.question: True or False: Paul sent Tychicus to the Colossians to declare the state of Paul's affairs and comfort their hearts.
questions.explanation: Tychicus was sent as a beloved brother to inform and comfort the Colossians.

questions.question: Who is Onesimus, mentioned in the letter to the Colossians?
options: A beloved brother and one of the Colossians
questions.correctAnswer: A beloved brother and one of the Colossians
questions.explanation: Onesimus is identified as a faithful and beloved brother who is one of the Colossians.

questions.question: Which person mentioned in Colossians is described as 'my fellowprisoner'?
questions.explanation: Aristarchus is called Paul's fellowprisoner in the letter.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs Archippus to take heed to the ministry he has received in the Lord.
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts Archippus to fulfill his ministry faithfully.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with ______, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.'
questions.explanation: Speech should be gracious and seasoned with salt for wisdom.

questions.question: What is the mystery Paul refers to that was hidden for ages but now made manifest to the saints?
options: The inclusion of the Gentiles in Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The inclusion of the Gentiles in Christ
questions.explanation: The mystery is Christ in you, the hope of glory, revealed to the Gentiles.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that if the Colossians continue in faith grounded and settled, they will not be moved away from the hope of the gospel.
questions.explanation: Continuing in grounded faith preserves hope in the gospel.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'image of the invisible God'?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ is the image of the invisible God.

questions.question: What does Paul say has been nailed to the cross?
options: The handwriting of ordinances that was against us
questions.correctAnswer: The handwriting of ordinances that was against us
questions.explanation: Paul states the ordinances contrary to us were nailed to the cross.

questions.question: True or False: Paul describes that the fullness of the Godhead dwells bodily in Christ.
questions.explanation: Christ contains all the fullness of Deity bodily.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the traditions and rudiments of the world compared to Christ?
options: They are after the rudiments of the world and not after Christ
questions.correctAnswer: They are after the rudiments of the world and not after Christ
questions.explanation: Paul warns against philosophies and traditions not according to Christ.

questions.question: Which chapter contains Paul's instruction to wives, husbands, children, fathers, servants, and masters?
questions.explanation: Colossians 3 contains household instructions for various family and social roles.

questions.question: True or False: Paul commands Christians to lie to one another to protect each other.
questions.explanation: Paul commands that they lie not one to another.

questions.question: What does Paul say is the source of strength for believers, according to Colossians?
options: All might according to His glorious power
questions.correctAnswer: All might according to His glorious power
questions.explanation: Strength comes from God's glorious power working in believers.

questions.question: What should 'rule in your hearts' according to Colossians 3?
questions.explanation: Paul says let the peace of God rule in your hearts.

questions.question: Which city is mentioned alongside Laodicea and Hierapolis in the letter?
questions.explanation: Colosse is the city receiving the letter; Laodicea and Hierapolis are nearby cities mentioned.

questions.question: Who is described as 'the beloved physician' in Colossians?
questions.explanation: Luke is referred to as the beloved physician.

questions.question: True or False: Paul tells the Colossians to read this epistle also in the church of the Laodiceans.
questions.explanation: Paul requests that the letter be read in the Laodicean church as well.

questions.question: Who is Marcus, mentioned in the letter, related to?
questions.explanation: Marcus is the sister's son to Barnabas.

questions.question: What is Paul's attitude toward his sufferings for the church, according to Colossians?
options: He rejoices and fills up afflictions
questions.correctAnswer: He rejoices and fills up afflictions
questions.explanation: Paul rejoices in sufferings that fill up what is behind of Christ's afflictions for the church.

questions.question: True or False: The letter commands children to obey their parents in all things as it is well pleasing unto the Lord.
questions.explanation: Children are instructed to obey their parents to please the Lord.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the penalty for those who do wrong?
options: They shall receive for the wrong which they have done
questions.correctAnswer: They shall receive for the wrong which they have done
questions.explanation: Paul states there is no respect of persons; wrongdoers will receive their due.

questions.question: What is the role of Christ in the body, the church, according to Colossians?
questions.explanation: Christ is described as the head of the body, the church.

questions.question: True or False: Paul warns against voluntary humility and worship of angels.
questions.explanation: Paul warns that such practices can beguile and puff up the fleshly mind.

questions.question: What does Paul instruct masters to remember in their treatment of servants?
options: That they have a Master in heaven
That servants must obey no matter what
That servants are less than them
questions.correctAnswer: That they have a Master in heaven
questions.explanation: Masters should be just and equal, remembering their own Master in heaven.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And whatsoever ye do, do it ______, as to the Lord, and not unto men.'
questions.explanation: Paul encourages wholehearted work as serving the Lord.

questions.question: According to Colossians, what should be the believer's attitude towards anger and wrath?
questions.explanation: Paul commands to put off anger, wrath, and other sinful behaviors.

questions.question: True or False: Paul calls for believers to be rooted and built up in Christ, stablished in the faith with thanksgiving.
questions.explanation: Believers are exhorted to be solidly grounded and growing in Christ.

questions.question: Who is instructed to 'Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord'?
questions.explanation: Paul specifically instructs Archippus to fulfill his ministry.

questions.question: What is the hope that is laid up for the Colossians in heaven?
questions.explanation: The hope of glory is Christ in you, the hope laid up in heaven.
